About me • Blog

Hello world! I'm Samuel Njoroge, 29 years old Independent Software Engineer, Pythonista, Internet Freedom and Linux advocate, maker, world citizen.

I have worked on many projects and hacked different technologies. I support Linux and Open Source and believe on its potential to change the world on many ways. I believe in a more collaborative and open society and how technology can empower people and provide a positive experience. All thoughts on this site are my own and don't represent any employer or company. Technologies I've hacked on: - HTML - Browser Javascript (bare-bones / in-house libraries / AngularJS / BackboneJS / ES6 / Gulp / Bower) - Python / Node.js / C / C++ /Perl (not a big fan) /Java(Only Android) - PostGIS / GoogleMaps / OpenStreetMaps / Geomatics - PostgreSQL / MongoDB / MySQL - ElasticSearch / RabbitMQ / Redis / Solr - Google AppEngine, Amazon AWS, OpenStack - Shell scripting - Linux, FreeBSD, Solaris - Intel, ARM, Arduino, Raspberry-PI Android I build software for users. I use whatever technology makes sense to build the product and makes it better. Open Source and Linux advocate. Maker by nature , always trying to hack and create new inventions.

My professional résumé.

I'm originally fom Nairobi, Kenya; lived in Virginia, New Jersey and now located in Dallas, Texas.
